title: Submission of the First Biennial Transparency Report of Sri Lanka to the 	United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
decision_details: - Sri Lanka has been a party to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change since 1993 and the Paris Agreement since 2016. Accordingly, Sri Lanka is committed to implementing the decisions taken by the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and the Paris Agreement. Under Article 13 of the Paris Agreement, each party should submit its First Biennial Transparency Report in relation to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change before 2024‑12‑31. The First Biennial Transparency Report of Sri Lanka has been prepared in keeping with guidelines of the the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and the Paris Agreement. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to submit the said Report to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, was approved by the Cabinet.
